title: Wrapped with Care
description:
Beeswax is a sticky substance produced naturally from bees, traditionally used as the 'first plastic'. Wraps made out of beeswax are hence more organic and pliable, offering a sustainable and long-lasting solution to plastic wraps.

In a bid to bring brand personality alongside a tactical product-driven communication approach, we highlight, through a quirky 30 sec YouTube ad, the sticky situation plastic-use brings and how Gaia’s sustainable and long-lasting wraps are the perfect antidote.
author: Team: Taylor Henderson; Risha George;

title: Ben&Jerry’s - Try them chilled!
description:
I made this project as a part of copywriting class with mentor Käthe Trumbach. The emphasis of the project is on a copy. The brand has a history of fighting for human rights so I focused on that aspect and created a campaign to fight against patriarchal norms and homophobia.

As coming out is one of the most important and difficult steps in LGBTQ+ community, campaign is aimed at normalizing the process and make it part of our everyday lives.

title: Mac cosmetics
author: Team: Mehdi Bouktache; Vika Randrup;
description: Domestic violence is still a huge problem today and it is not talked about enough in our society. In most cases, victims use makeup to cover traces of physical violence. With the #MyReality campaign, we want to raise awareness and use a new product design as a conversational starter.

title: E-scooter app design
description: This is my final project for UX/UI design basics course at 303Px - Graphic Design School in Tbilisi, Georgia. The objective of the project was to create e-scooter app design. In recent years, electronic scooters became widly popular in Tbilisi, as part of the city trends of catching up with the rest of the world. I designed the app taking into account younger generation being the target audience for the app. For that reason main inspiration of my design was Tbilisi street art.

title: Robobo - Board Game
author: Game design: Tsibakha Games

title: Candy Crush - Moms vs Noobs
description: Project explanation text allalalalalalla  This is student work. Names, characters, brands, places and incidents either are products of the author’s imagination or are used fictitiously. This work is designed to showcase the student’s ability to work with real world brands in real world applications. Any resemblance to actual events, brands, campaigns, locales or persons, living or dead, is entirely coincidental. This presentation is meant for educational purposes only.
